snippet: After organizing protests against Cameroon’s president, Angele Nogue, now in the Bronx, was arrested and lost her business and her home.
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York provides Cameroon refugee Angele Nogue, now living in Bronx homeless shelter with her son, with funds to purchase a laptop and extra blankets.
lead_paragraph: After organizing protests against Cameroon’s president, Angele Nogue, now in the Bronx, was arrested and lost her business and her home.

headline.main: For Survivor of Political Strife, the Journey Continues in the Bronx
headline.print_headline: For Survivor of Political Strife, the Journey Continues in the Bronx
